verses.verse: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:
“Can anyone be of the slightest interest to God, even if that person is recognized for his wisdom?
Does the Almighty derive any pleasure if you are righteous? Does he profit if you lead a blameless life?
Is he punishing you for your piety and therefore will bring you to justice?
Is not your wickedness great? Is there any limit to your iniquities?
“You have exacted pledges from your brothers as security and left them naked, stripped of their clothing.[d]
To the thirsty you offered no water to drink, and you withheld bread from those who were starving.
Should the land belong only to the powerful? Are only those who are favored allowed to dwell in it?
“You have sent widows away empty-handed and left orphans without any means of support.
That is why snares surround you and sudden terror causes you to cringe,
why light has turned to darkness, leaving you unable to see, and flood waters envelop you.
“Does not God who dwells in the heights of the heavens behold how lofty are the highest stars?
Even so, you say, ‘What does God know? How can he possibly judge through such deep darkness?
He cannot possibly see through the thick clouds as he roams through the vault of the heavens.’
“Will you still continue to follow the ancient way that those who are wicked have trod?
They were snatched away before their time; their foundations were swept away by a flood.[e]
They had said to God, ‘Leave us alone!’ and thought, ‘What can the Almighty do to us?’
“Yet it was he who filled their houses with good things, even though his plans and theirs were diametrically opposed.
The upright rejoice at witnessing such a spectacle, and the innocent deride them:
‘See how our enemies have been destroyed, and what remained of their wealth has been consumed by fire.’[f]
“Come to terms with God and be reconciled. In this way good fortune will come to you.
Accept the instruction from his lips and keep his words in your heart.[g]
If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored; if you remove iniquity from your tent
and treat gold as if it were only dust and the gold of Ophir[h] as pebbles from the stream,
then the Almighty himself will be your gold and your precious silver.
“For then the Almighty will be your delight and you will lift up your face to God.
You will pray to him and he will hear you, and you will fulfill your vows.
Whatever decision you make will be successful, and light will shine along your path.
For God brings low the arrogant while he saves the humble.
He delivers anyone who is innocent; if your hands are clean, you will be saved.”
